title: Harvard vs. Trump: What to know about the costly standoff
shortDescription: Trump's administration has frozen more than $2 billion in grants and contracts for Harvard. The higher education fight explained.

title: Trump fires Democratic board members of the credit union watchdog
shortDescription: The White House has fired two Democratic board members of the National Credit Union Administration in push to sway independent regulatory agencies.

title: Trump admin threatened with contempt of court over deportations
shortDescription: A federal judge found "probable cause" to hold the administration in contempt for violating his order halting deportations under a wartime law.

title: Newsom says he's suing Trump administration to block sweeping tariffs
shortDescription: Gov. Gavin Newsom and AG Rob Bonta say Trump's emergency tariffs illegally harm California, the nation's largest manufacturing and farming state

title: El Salvador prison: House Dems want an official visit
shortDescription: The request comes after the Supreme Court ordered the administration to 'facilitate' the release of Kilmar Abrego Garcia from a notorious prison.

title: White House tariff figure for China causes confusion
shortDescription: The U.S. already imposed tariffs on some Chinese products of up to 100%. Add that to the 145% in new tariffs and some products face 245% tariffs.

title: Democrat Nathan Sage to challenge Joni Ernst for Iowa Senate seat
shortDescription: Sage said he plans to campaign on making life easier for the working class through better pay, better health care and making life more affordable.

title: DOJ sues Maine over Trump, transgender athletes
shortDescription: The federal lawsuit comes after the Trump administration tried to cut off all of Maine's federal funding for public schools and school lunches.

title: Trump meeting with Japanese officials on tariffs
shortDescription: "Japan is coming in today to negotiate Tariffs, the cost of military support, and 'TRADE FAIRNESS,'" Trump wrote on social media on April 16.

title: Daily Briefing: IRS melts as tax season blooms
shortDescription: The federal tax agency's busiest time comes amid mass worker departures. Here's Wednesday news to know.

title: Biden gives first post-presidency speech
shortDescription: Former President Joe Biden, in his first public remarks since leaving office, criticized the Trump administrationâ€™s handling of Social Security.

title: Joe Biden accuses Trump of 'taking a hatchet' to Social Security
shortDescription: Former President Biden accused Donald Trump of "taking a hatchet" to the Social Security Administration as he made a return to the national stage.

title: Joe Biden makes first major speech since leaving office
shortDescription: President Joe Biden spoke during a conference of the Advocates, Counselors and Representatives for the Disabled (ACRD) in Chicago on April 15, 2025.

title: Can Harvard afford to defy Trump?
shortDescription: The Trump administration has vowed to freeze more than $2 billion in funds for the nation's most prestigious college. Harvard is fighting back.

title: See how Trump blinged out the Oval Office he inherited from Biden
shortDescription: Each president makes the Oval Office in the White House their own. See some of the differences between Biden and Trump.
